title: No wonder why I never see AD fighters top lane anymore
body: Doesn't matter how fed you are, a 0 cs Janna is more useful than you later since she makes you completely useless

replies.body:
Janna is a one trick pony.  She is built for one thing, and that is to deny wombo combo teams from womboing your team.  Her shield and slow are there to again, keep you away.  However, Janna isn't built to defend well against siege/poke teams, and teams that can snipe specific people (pick teams) can get in between her cooldowns and escape.  Wombo combo teams are typically built with bruisers and mages that have large, usually team wide ults (five man Lissandra ults, etc).

But, if you decide to use a poke team or protect team, your bruisers have a place and Janna is then the useless one.  Janna isn't designed to engage ONTO poke and protect teams, and that is precisely what you need to do to defeat them.  For a protect team, you will need a snipe on the designated carry, though, before jumping on top of three to four bruisers.

The thing is that it's not one champion. Mages in general excell against melee. Comparing other supports: Nami will bubble you, kite you easily thanks to E + passive, poke you while healing herself and if all else fails use her ult to knock you up. A Nami that doesn't want you to get close won't let you any closer than Janna. Sona has E and her E Power Chord while poking and sustaining thanks to her other skills, etc. By the time you get to Sona you're half health. And again she has her panic button just like Janna: Crescendo.

Mages and mage supports as a class counter melee. Janna is better than the rest because of her MS steroids but she's not unique. Most mages say no to melee interaction unless that melee has a variety of gapclosers.
